centroid: centroid calculation algorithms


Functions

template<typename PC , typename PP , template< typename, typename > class VP, template< typename, typename > class VR, template< typename > class AP, template< typename > class AR, typename S >

 Calculate centroid of polygon.
template<typename PC , typename PP , template< typename, typename > class VP, template< typename, typename > class VR, template< typename > class AP, template< typename > class AR>
void geometry::centroid (const polygon< PP, VP, VR, AP, AR > &poly, PC &c)
 Calculate centroid of polygon.

Detailed Description

The centroid of a surface geometry returns a point which is the centroid the geometry.

Function Documentation

template<typename PC , typename PP , template< typename, typename > class VP, template< typename, typename > class VR, template< typename > class AP, template< typename > class AR, typename S >
void geometry::centroid ( const polygon< PP, VP, VR, AP, AR > &  poly,
PC &  c,
const S &  strategy 
)

Calculate centroid of polygon.

The function centroid calculates the centroid of a polygon. This version takes a specified strategy for centroid calculation. The polygon should be closed and orientated clockwise, holes, if any, must be orientated counter clockwise

Parameters:
poly a closed polygon
c reference to point which will contain the centroid
strategy Calculation strategy for centroid
Exceptions:
centroid_exception if calculation is not successful, e.g. because polygon didn't contain points
Examples:
4_polygon_example.cpp.

template<typename PC , typename PP , template< typename, typename > class VP, template< typename, typename > class VR, template< typename > class AP, template< typename > class AR>
void geometry::centroid ( const polygon< PP, VP, VR, AP, AR > &  poly,
PC &  c 
)

Calculate centroid of polygon.

The function centroid calculates the centroid of a polygon using the default strategy. The polygon should be closed and orientated clockwise, holes, if any, must be orientated counter clockwise

Parameters:
poly a closed polygon
c reference to point which will contain the centroid
Exceptions:
centroid_exception if calculation is not successful, e.g. because polygon didn't contain points
Note:
It does not RETURN the centroid. The type of the centroid-point might be different from the type of the polygon-points. Therefore it is a reference, this avoids inconvenient calls as center = centroid<geometry::point_xy<double> >(poly);
Example:
Example showing centroid calculation 
{
        geometry::polygon<geometry::point_xy<double> > poly;
        geometry::from_wkt("POLYGON((0 0,0 7,4 2,2 0,0 0))", poly);
        // Center of polygon might have different type then points of polygon
        geometry::point_xy<float> center;
        geometry::centroid(poly, center);
        std::cout << "Centroid: " << center.x() << "," << center.y() << std::endl;
}
